metaDescription: Premium 2-bedroom apartment in Guardamar del Segura for €228,000. Ideal for retirement. 50% less than Jávea. Peaceful coastal living on Costa Blanca.
heroIntro: Discover peaceful retirement living in this beautifully appointed 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom apartment in Guardamar del Segura, priced at just €228,000. Located on Spain's sun-soaked Costa Blanca, this property offers the relaxed lifestyle you've earned, complete with year-round sunshine and a welcoming international expat community. What makes this apartment exceptional is its premium specification at €2,651 per square meter—remarkably 50% less expensive than comparable properties in nearby Jávea, yet offering equivalent quality and finishes. The 86-square-meter layout is thoughtfully designed for comfortable, easy living, with two generous bedrooms and bathrooms positioned to maximize your space efficiency. Guardamar del Segura has evolved into a favored destination for retirees seeking authentic Spanish charm without the overdevelopment of larger coastal towns. Here, you'll find a harmonious blend of British and Scandinavian expat communities alongside genuinely local Spanish culture, creating a genuinely welcoming atmosphere. The town's excellent healthcare facilities, including the nearby Hospital de Torrevieja and local health centers staffed with English-speaking professionals, provide complete peace of mind. With beautiful beaches just minutes away, excellent golf courses, and a vibrant weekly market, your retirement will be filled with activities and social connection.
areaSection: Guardamar del Segura sits on the southern Costa Blanca in Alicante province, a charming coastal town that has carefully maintained its authentic Spanish character while warmly welcoming international residents. The town benefits from an enviable Mediterranean climate with over 300 days of annual sunshine, making it ideal for outdoor enthusiasts and those seeking consistent, warm weather. Unlike the overcrowded resort atmosphere of nearby Torrevieja, Guardamar offers a more relaxed, authentic Spanish experience with tree-lined streets, traditional architecture, and a strong sense of community. The town is strategically positioned between Alicante airport (45 minutes) and Torrevieja (20 minutes), providing convenient access while maintaining peaceful seclusion. The Segura River creates a natural boundary, and the town's proximity to pristine, dune-backed beaches—some awarded Blue Flag status—adds significant lifestyle value without the chaos of mass tourism.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Guardamar del Segura revolves around a slower pace that most retirees crave. Mornings might include a coffee at a local café before browsing the lively Wednesday market, where vendors sell fresh produce, local crafts, and seasonal goods. The expat community is substantial but not overwhelming, with established British and Scandinavian groups organizing regular social events, dining clubs, and leisure activities. Healthcare is readily accessible, with English-speaking doctors at private clinics and the efficient Spanish public health system available to residents. You'll find excellent restaurants serving both Spanish cuisine and familiar international options, golf courses within 10-20 minutes for enthusiasts, and beautiful beaches perfect for evening walks or weekend relaxation. The town's compact size means you can access everything by car without navigating the congestion of larger cities, yet it maintains genuine Spanish atmosphere with local businesses, traditional bars, and real community interaction with Spanish residents.
investmentSection: This property represents exceptional value in the Costa Blanca market. At €228,000, you're purchasing a premium-specification apartment at nearly 50% less cost per square meter than similar properties in nearby Jávea, while maintaining equivalent quality standards. The Costa Blanca property market has demonstrated consistent growth, with prices appreciating at approximately 7% year-on-year, suggesting strong long-term value retention. For those considering rental income, similar apartments in Guardamar typically generate €700 per week during peak season, offering potential for 4-5 months annual rental income if desired. This price point positions the property above the Guardamar average of €1,750/m² due to premium finishes, yet remains remarkably affordable compared to more developed coastal areas. Whether you're buying for personal retirement enjoyment or as an investment, this apartment offers compelling value and appreciation potential.
conclusion: This €228,000 apartment in Guardamar del Segura represents your gateway to the peaceful, sun-filled retirement you've envisioned. With premium specifications at remarkably accessible pricing, year-round Mediterranean climate, excellent healthcare, and a welcoming international community, this property delivers genuine value without compromise. The combination of beach proximity, golf courses, authentic Spanish atmosphere, and practical daily conveniences creates an ideal environment for active, engaged retirement living. Whether you're seeking permanent relocation or a Mediterranean base for extended seasonal stays, this apartment provides the space, quality, and location to enjoy your retirement fully. Everything you need is accessible without the stress of city-center congestion, creating the ideal environment for relaxed retirement living.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in Guardamar del Segura is comprehensively available and retiree-friendly. The town has a Centro de Salud Guardamar providing primary medical care, with English-speaking doctors available at private clinics. The excellent Hospital de Torrevieja—Spain's leading private hospital—is just 15 minutes away, offering comprehensive services including emergency care, specialties, and English-language support. The Spanish public healthcare system (available to residents with proper registration) provides high-quality, affordable medical care. Pharmacies are conveniently located throughout town with professional staff knowledgeable about medications. For retirees prioritizing healthcare accessibility, Guardamar provides reassuring options combining Spanish medical excellence with English-language support.

shopping.text: Daily shopping in Guardamar combines convenience with authentic Spanish experience. Mercadona, Lidl, and Consum supermarkets offer competitive pricing on groceries and household essentials, with English-language options increasingly available. The legendary Wednesday market features fresh produce, local crafts, seasonal items, and genuine Spanish atmosphere—a highlight of many residents' weeks. Larger shopping centers in nearby Torrevieja provide additional retail options for clothing, electronics, and specialized items. The compact town means shopping never requires significant travel, and food quality from Spanish sources remains excellent year-round.

transport.text: Getting around Guardamar del Segura is straightforward and convenient. Most amenities are accessible by car within 10-15 minutes maximum, with peaceful, manageable traffic compared to larger cities. Public buses connect to Torrevieja (20 minutes) and Alicante for those preferring not to drive. Alicante-Elche airport is 45 minutes away by car, providing direct flights to UK, Germany, Scandinavia, and across Europe. While a car is recommended for maximum flexibility and exploring the broader Costa Blanca region, the town's compact size means even short-term visitors can navigate easily. Parking throughout Guardamar is generally available and inexpensive.

faqs.question: Hur mycket kostar denna fastighet?
faqs.answer: €228,000. This price includes a premium-specification 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom apartment with excellent finishes, positioned 50% below comparable Jávea pricing. No hidden fees are typical in Spanish property sales when working with established agents, though you'll need to budget separately for legal costs (approximately 6-8% of purchase price) and transfer taxes (approximately 6-10% depending on region).

faqs.question: Är Costa Blanca bra för pensionärer?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca is excellent for retirees. The region offers year-round sunshine, excellent healthcare facilities, established expat communities, affordable cost of living compared to Northern Europe, beautiful beaches, and numerous leisure activities including golf and water sports. Guardamar del Segura specifically provides authentic Spanish atmosphere without overdevelopment, making it particularly appealing for retirees seeking community and cultural engagement.

faqs.question: Kan utlänningar köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can freely purchase property in Spain without restrictions. Non-resident foreigners require a Spanish tax identification number (NIE) for the purchase, obtained through your Spanish attorney. You'll need a Spanish bank account for funds transfer and mortgage purposes. Many UK, Scandinavian, and international retirees own property in Spain—the process is straightforward when working with experienced legal advisors familiar with international purchases.

faqs.question: Vilka är kostnaderna för att köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Beyond the property purchase price, expect additional costs of 8-12% total: approximately 6-10% transfer tax (ITP in the Valencian region), 2-3% notary and registration fees, and variable legal fees (1-2%). Stamp duty and other minor fees may apply. First-time buyer exemptions or reductions may be available—your attorney will advise on applicable benefits for your situation. Mortgage costs (if obtaining Spanish financing) typically involve 2-3% in valuation and insurance fees.

faqs.question: Hur är levnadskostnaderna på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Guardamar del Segura is significantly lower than Northern Europe. Groceries cost 30-40% less than UK prices, utilities average €80-120 monthly (depending on usage), dining out costs €10-15 for quality meals, and entertainment is affordable. Overall, retirees typically live comfortably on €1,200-1,800 monthly if owning property outright, or €1,800-2,400 if accounting for mortgage payments. Healthcare costs depend on whether using public system (minimal costs) or private insurance.

faqs.question: Hur långt är det från Sverige till Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport (45 minutes from Guardamar del Segura) offers direct flights to London, Manchester, and other UK cities, with flight times of approximately 2-2.5 hours. Budget airlines like Ryanair and easyJet provide competitive pricing, making UK visits convenient. Many retirees maintain close UK connections while enjoying Spanish retirement, returning 2-4 times yearly for family visits. The short flight time makes transatlantic staying connected easy.

faqs.question: Hur är vädret på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with over 300 days of annual sunshine, average temperatures of 17°C in winter and 29°C in summer. Rainfall averages 250-300mm annually, concentrated in autumn and spring, leaving most of the year dry and sunny. Winter months (December-February) are mild, averaging 12-15°C daytime temperatures—perfect for outdoor activities without extreme heat. The climate is medically beneficial for those with arthritis or respiratory conditions, contributing to the region's popularity with retirees.

faqs.question: How much rental income could I generate from this apartment?
faqs.answer: Similar 2-bedroom apartments in Guardamar del Segura typically generate €600-800 per week during peak season (June-September), with lower rates (€400-500 weekly) in shoulder seasons. Annual occupancy varies but conservative estimates suggest 20-25 weeks of rental income, generating €12,000-20,000 annually. This helps offset property ownership costs while maintaining personal use flexibility. Professional property management companies handle bookings and maintenance, typically charging 20-30% commission.

faqs.question: Behöver jag visum för att köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: No, you do not require a visa specifically to purchase property in Spain—the property transaction and ownership are separate from visa/residency requirements. However, if planning extended stays (over 90 days), you'll need appropriate visa status. UK retirees can apply for the Non-Lucrative Visa (renewable annually) if demonstrating financial means of approximately €27,792 annual income. Spanish residency involves separate processes from property purchase but offers tax benefits and healthcare access.

faqs.question: Is Guardamar del Segura better than Torrevieja for retirees?
faqs.answer: Both towns appeal to retirees but serve different preferences. Guardamar del Segura offers quieter, more authentic Spanish atmosphere with genuine community integration, smaller town convenience, and lower property costs. Torrevieja provides more entertainment, international dining options, larger expat community, and more developed infrastructure. Guardamar suits retirees seeking peaceful authenticity and cultural engagement, while Torrevieja appeals to those preferring bustling social scenes and familiar international amenities. Guardamar's proximity to Torrevieja (20 minutes) allows enjoying both.
